newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Eight crew rescued from ship on fire off Ireland.
newsitem.headline: Eight crew rescued from ship on fire off Ireland.

text.p: Eight people were rescued from a blazing trawler off the Irish coast on Saturday and flown by helicopter to an Irish lighthouse, rescue services said.
At least four people were still believed to be aboard the Spanish-crewed vessel Shark, which sent out a mayday signal after fire broke out in the wheelhouse some 120 miles off the Irish coast.
The Irish rescue helicopter was planning to return to the ship after refuelling .
Earlier reports had put the crew of the vessel at 17 but rescue officials said they were not sure of the exact numbers. It was not known whether any of the crew had been injured in the fire.
Rescuers had to battle heavy seas and gales to get near the fishing boat. Two lifeboats and two German fishing trawlers are still heading towards the scene.
